title: Phúc-âm Theo Sứ đồ GIăNG
chapter:
CHAPTER 1.
In the beginning was the Word, Và the Word was with God, Và the Word was God.
The same was in the beginning with God. All things were made by him; Và without him was not any thing made that was made. In him was life; Và the life was the light of men. Và the light shineth in darkness; Và the darkness comprehended it not. There was a man sent from God, whose name was Giăng. The same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all men through him might believe. He was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light. That was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.The word "that" is included in the verb form as its subject. It should not be sent as an added word. He was in the world, Và the world was made by him, Và the world knew him not. He came unto his own, Và his own received him not. But as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons của ĐCT, even to them that believe on his name:The tois is sunstantival meaning "to the ones" so it needs its own marking. Which were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God. Và the Word was made flesh, Và dwelt among us, (Và we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace Và truth. Giăng bare witness of him, Và cried, saying, This was he of whom I spake, He that cometh after me is preferred before me: for he was before me.The "ho" is tagged because it acts as an intensifier, not really part of the verb in the role of a normal pronoun. Và of his fulness have all we received, Và grace for grace. For the law was given by Môi-se, but grace Và truth came by Giê-su Christ. không ai hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared him.The "ho" is tagged because it acts separtely as a relative pronoun. Và this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests Và Levites from Giê-ru-sa-lem to ask him, Who art thou? Và he confessed, Và denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ. Và they asked him, What then? Art thou Ê-li? Và he saith, I am not. Art thou that prophet? Và he answered, No. Then said they unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?"to them" is substantival. He said, I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way của Chúa, as said the prophet Esaias. Và they which were sent were of the những người Pha-ri-si.The "hoi" is sunstantival and not part of the verb form. Và they asked him, Và said unto him, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Ê-li, neither that prophet? Giăng answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;The F1-Fi tags should go around "one" or "whom." Both are not included in "hon." He it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose."Hou" is a relative pronoun and belongs with "whose." There is no direct word to go with "autou" in the KJV translation. These things were done in Bethabara beyond Giô-đanh, where Giăng was baptizing. The next day Giăng seeth Giê-su coming unto him, Và saith, kìa the Lamb của ĐCT, which taketh away the sin of the world."ho" substantizes the participle "airwn." This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me."he" need s to be put in the F1-Fi tags as it is supplied from the context. Và I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water. Và Giăng bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, Và it abode upon him. Và I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending, Và remaining on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost. Và I saw, Và bare record that this is the Son của ĐCT. Again the next day after Giăng stood, Và two of his disciples; Và looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, kìa the Lamb của ĐCT! Và the two disciples heard him speak, Và they followed Giê-su. Then Giê-su turned, Và saw them following, and saith unto them, What seek ye? They said unto him, Rabbi, (which is to say, being interpreted, Master,) where dwellest thou?"and" should be in the F1-fi brackets. He saith unto them, Come Và see. They came Và saw where he dwelt, Và abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour. One of the two which heard Giăng speak, Và followed him, was An-rê, Si-môn Peter's brother. He first findeth his own brother Si-môn, Và saith unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ. Và he brought him to Giê-su. Và when Giê-su beheld him, he said, Thou art Si-môn the son of Jona: thou shalt be called Cephas, which is by interpretation, A stone. The day following Giê-su would go forth into Ga-li-lê, Và findeth Philip, Và saith unto him, Follow me. Now Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew Và Phi-e-rơ. Philip findeth Nathanael, Và saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Môi-se in the law, Và the prophets, did write, Giê-su of Nazareth, the son of Giô-sép. Và Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come Và see. Giê-su saw Nathanael coming to him, Và saith of him, kìa an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile! Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Giê-su answered Và said unto him, Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee."tou" here refers to the act itself of seeing and so does not behave as an article but rather as a substantive. Nathanael answered Và saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son của ĐCT; thou art the King of Israel. Giê-su answered Và said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these. Và he saith unto him, Quả thật, Quả thật, I say unto you, Hereafter ye shall see heaven open, Và the angels của ĐCT ascending Và descending upon the Son of man."apo arti" is an idiom, two words taken together to mean "hereafter."

CHAPTER 2. Và the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Ga-li-lê; Và the mother của [Chúa] Giê-su was there: Và both Giê-su was called, Và his disciples, to the marriage. Và when they wanted wine, the mother của [Chúa] Giê-su saith unto him, They have no wine. Giê-su saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come. His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it. Và there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece. Giê-su saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. Và they filled them up to the brim. Và he saith unto them, Draw out now, Và bear unto the governor of the feast. Và they bare it. When the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, Và knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom, Và saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; Và when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast kept the good wine until now. This beginning of miracles did Giê-su in Cana of Ga-li-lê, Và manifested forth his glory; Và his disciples believed on him. After this he went down to Capernaum, he, Và his mother, Và his brethren, Và his disciples: Và they continued there not many days. Và the Jews' passover was at hand, Và Giê-su went up to Giê-ru-sa-lem, Và found in the temple those that sold oxen Và sheep Và doves, Và the changers of money sitting: Và when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, Và the sheep, Và the oxen; Và poured out the changers' money, Và overthrew the tables; Và said unto them that sold doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father's house an house of merchandise. Và his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up. Then answered the Jews Và said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things? Giê-su answered Và said unto them, Destroy this temple, Và in three days I will raise it up. Then said the Jews, Forty Và six years was this temple in building, Và wilt thou rear it up in three days?egereis auton (wilt.. rear it up) - need 3-way split tagged auton as 'it up's But he spake of the temple of his body. When therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; Và they believed the scripture, Và the word which Giê-su had said. Now when he was in Giê-ru-sa-lem at the passover, in the feast day, many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did. But Giê-su did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all men, Và needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.

CHAPTER 3.
Có
một người từ những người Pha-ri-si, Ni-cô-đem [là]tên của ông, [là] một lãnh đạo của dân Do-thái :
Người này đến cùng Ngài vào buổi tối, và nói với Ngài, Rabbi (Thưa Thầy), chúng tôi biết rằng thầy là giáo sư đến từ ĐCT: Vì không ai có thể làm những phép lạ này mà thầy làm,
nếu ĐCT không ở cùng với người.
[Chúa] Giê-su đáp và nói với người, Quả thật, quả thật, Ta nói cùng ngươi, ngoại trừ một người được sinh lại, [thì] không thể thấy nước ĐCT. ??ou dounatai - split 'cannot's Ni-cô-đem saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter the second time into his mother's womb, Và be born? Giê-su answered, Quả thật, Quả thật, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water Và of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom của ĐCT.??ou dounati - split 'cannot's That which is born of the flesh is flesh; Và that which is born of the Spirit is spirit. Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again. The wind bloweth where it listeth, Và thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, Và whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit. Ni-cô-đem answered Và said unto him, How can these things be? Giê-su answered Và said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, Và knowest not these things? Quả thật, Quả thật, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, Và testify that we have seen; Và ye receive not our witness. If I have told you earthly things, Và ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you of heavenly things? Và không ai hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, even the Son of man which is in heaven. Và as Môi-se lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life. For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life. For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved. He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son của ĐCT. Và this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, Và men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil. For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.hina mee (lest) - hina empty But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God. After these things came Giê-su Và his disciples into the land of xứ Giu-đê; Và there he tarried with them, Và baptized. Và Giăng also was baptizing in Ænon near to Salim, because there was much water there: Và they came, Và were baptized. For Giăng was not yet cast into prison. Then there arose a question between some of John's disciples Và the Jews about purifying. Và they came unto Giăng, Và said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Giô-đanh, to whom thou barest witness, kìa, the same baptizeth, Và all men come to him. Giăng answered Và said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven. Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him. He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth Và heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled. He must increase, but I must decrease. He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, Và speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all. Và what he hath seen Và heard, that he testifieth; Và không ai receiveth his testimony. He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true. For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words của ĐCT: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him. The Father loveth the Son, Và hath given all things into his hand. He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: Và he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath của ĐCT abideth on him.

CHAPTER 4. When therefore the Lord knew how the những người Pha-ri-si had heard that Giê-su made Và baptized more disciples than Giăng, (Though Giê-su himself baptized not, but his disciples,) He left xứ Giu-đê, Và departed again into Ga-li-lê. Và he must needs go through Samaria. Then cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Giô-sép. Now Jacob's well was there. Giê-su therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well: Và it was about the sixth hour. There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Giê-su saith unto her, Give me to drink. (For his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.) Then saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans. Giê-su answered Và said unto her, If thou knewest the gift của ĐCT, Và who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, Và he would have given thee living water. The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, Và the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water? Art thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, Và drank thereof himself, Và his children, Và his cattle?ex autou (thereof) - ex empty Giê-su answered Và said unto her, Whosoever drinketh of this water shall thirst again: But whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall be in him a well of water springing up into everlasting life.ou mee eis ton aioona (never) - tagged to aioona The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw. Giê-su saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, Và come hither. The woman answered Và said, I have no husband. Giê-su said unto her, Thou hast well said, I have no husband: For thou hast had five husbands; Và he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: in that saidst thou truly. The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet. Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; Và ye say, that in Giê-ru-sa-lem is the place where men ought to worship. Giê-su saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when ye shall neither in this mountain, nor yet at Giê-ru-sa-lem, worship the Father. Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for salvation is of the Jews. But the hour cometh, Và now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit Và in truth: for the Father seeketh such to worship him. God is a Spirit: Và they that worship him must worship him in spirit Và in truth. The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things. Giê-su saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he. Và upon this came his disciples, Và marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet không ai said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her? The woman then left her waterpot, Và went her way into the city, Và saith to the men, Come, see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ? Then they went out of the city, Và came unto him. In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat. But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of. Therefore said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him ought to eat? Giê-su saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, Và to finish his work. Say not ye, There are yet four months, Và then cometh harvest? kìa, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, Và look on the fields; for they are white already to harvest. Và he that reapeth receiveth wages, Và gathereth fruit unto life eternal: that both he that soweth Và he that reapeth may rejoice together. Và herein is that saying true, One soweth, Và another reapeth.estin ho speiroon (soweth) - estin empty I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestowed no labour: other men laboured, Và ye are entered into their labours. Và many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did. So when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: Và he abode there two days. Và many more believed because of his own word; Và said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard him ourselves, Và know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world. Now after two days he departed thence, Và went into Ga-li-lê. For Giê-su himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country. Then when he was come into Ga-li-lê, the Galilæans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Giê-ru-sa-lem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast. So Giê-su came again into Cana of Ga-li-lê, where he made the water wine. Và there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum. When he heard that Giê-su was come out of xứ Giu-đê into Ga-li-lê, he went unto him, Và besought him that he would come down, Và heal his son: for he was at the point of death. Then said Giê-su unto him, Except ye see signs Và wonders, ye will not believe. The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die. Giê-su saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. Và the man believed the word that Giê-su had spoken unto him, Và he went his way. Và as he was now going down, his servants met him, Và told him, saying, Thy son liveth. Then enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. Và they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him. So the father knew that it was at the same hour, in the which Giê-su said unto him, Thy son liveth: Và himself believed, Và his whole house. This is again the second miracle that Giê-su did, when he was come out of xứ Giu-đê into Ga-li-lê.

CHAPTER 5. After this there was a feast of the Jews; Và Giê-su went up to Giê-ru-sa-lem. Now there is at Giê-ru-sa-lem by the sheep market a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches. In these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water. For an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, Và troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had. Và a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.??Strange gap in Greek where 'okto' should be (tag 7) When Giê-su saw him lie, Và knew that he had been now a long time in that case, he saith unto him, Wilt thou be made whole? The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me. Giê-su saith unto him, Rise, take up thy bed, Và walk. Và tức thì the man was made whole, Và took up his bed, Và walked: Và on the same day was the sabbath. The Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the ngày Sa-bát: it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed. He answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, Và walk. Then asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take up thy bed, Và walk? Và he that was healed wist not who it was: for Giê-su had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in that place. Afterward Giê-su findeth him in the temple, Và said unto him, kìa, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing come unto thee.hina mee (lest) - mee empty The man departed, Và told the Jews that it was Giê-su, which had made him whole. Và therefore did the Jews persecute Giê-su, Và sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the ngày Sa-bát.dia touto (therefore) - touto empty But Giê-su answered them, My Father worketh hitherto, Và I work.eoos arti (till) - eoos empty Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.dia touto oun (therefore) - touto oun empty tagged idion (tag 19) as 'was his' Then answered Giê-su Và said unto them, Quả thật, Quả thật, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father do: for what things soever he doeth, these also doeth the Son likewise. For the Father loveth the Son, Và sheweth him all things that himself doeth: Và he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel. For as the Father raiseth up the dead, Và quickeneth them; even so the Son quickeneth whom he will. For the Father judgeth không ai, but hath committed all judgment unto the Son: That all men should honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son honoureth not the Father which hath sent him. Quả thật, Quả thật, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, Và believeth on him that sent me, hath everlasting life, Và shall not come into condemnation; but is passed from death unto life. Quả thật, Quả thật, I say unto you, The hour is coming, Và now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son của ĐCT: Và they that hear shall live. For as the Father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the Son to have life in himself; Và hath given him authority to execute judgment also, because he is the Son of man. Marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice, Và shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; Và they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of damnation. I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: Và my judgment is just; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of the Father which hath sent me. If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true. There is another that beareth witness of me; Và I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true. Ye sent unto Giăng, Và he bare witness unto the truth. But I receive not testimony from man: but these things I say, that ye might be saved. He was a burning Và a shining light: Và ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light. But I have greater witness than that of John: for the works which the Father hath given me to finish, the same works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.??repeat auta (tags 19, 20) Và the Father himself, which hath sent me, hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his shape. Và ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he hath sent, him ye believe not. Search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have eternal life: Và they are they which testify of me.??Strange repeated tag 2 Và ye will not come to me, that ye might have life. I receive not honour from men. But I know you, that ye have not tình yêu của ĐCT in you. I am come in my Father's name, Và ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive. How can ye believe, which receive honour one of another, Và seek not the honour that cometh from God only? Do not think that I will accuse you to the Father: there is one that accuseth you, even Môi-se, in whom ye trust. For had ye believed Môi-se, ye would have believed me: for he wrote of me. But if ye believe not his writings, how shall ye believe my words?
